text: The Supreme Governor of the Church of England is a title which British Monarchs have to show their leadership over the Church of England. The title was first granted to Queen Elizabeth I after she passed the Act of Supremacy, which required all officials in the Church of England to state an oath of allegiance to her. Category:Anglicanism Category:History of the United Kingdom Category:Monarchy of the United Kingdom Category:Protestant Reformation
title: Supreme Governor of the Church of England
